text: Shah Wali Ullah Nagar () is a neighborhood in Orangi Town in Karachi, Sindh, Pakistan.Orangi Town - Government of Karachi There are several ethnic groups including Muhajirs, Sindhis, Kashmiris, Punjabis, Pakhtuns, Balochis, Memons, Bohras and Ismailis. This neighbourhood is named in the honour of Qutb-ud-Dīn Ahmad ibn 'Abdul Rahīm (), also known as Shāh Walīullāh and Shāh WalĪ Allāh (1703–1762 CE / 1114–1176 AH) was an Islamic scholar, reformer and founder of modern Islamic thought who attempted to reassess Islamic theology in the light of modern changes. ==References== == External links == * Karachi Website Category:Neighbourhoods of Karachi Category:Orangi Town
title: Shah Wali Ullah Nagar
